solution_line_template: If Rayman takes {rayman_hours_per_week} hours doing his workouts, half the number of hours junior takes, then Junior takes {multiplier_for_junior}*{rayman_hours_per_week} = <<{rayman_hours_per_week}*{multiplier_for_junior}={junior_hours_per_week}>>{junior_hours_per_week} hours to do his workouts in a week.

Altogether, Junior and Rayman take {junior_hours_per_week}+{rayman_hours_per_week} = <<{junior_hours_per_week}+{rayman_hours_per_week}={combined_junior_rayman_hours}>>{combined_junior_rayman_hours} hours doing their workouts in a week.

Wolverine takes {wolverine_multiplier}*{combined_junior_rayman_hours} = <<{wolverine_multiplier}*{combined_junior_rayman_hours}={wolverine_hours_per_week}>>{wolverine_hours_per_week} hours to do her workouts in a week, twice the total number of hours Rayman and Junior takes.
